pull_request.title: umke.org - obsolete rule
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address


### Add your comment and screenshots

`umke.org` does not have the `ad_` element.
<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![resim png-mh](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/103899764/219540798-86ec28b5-e1a5-46aa-a4a8-371d7d5fceb7.png)

</details>

---

`yenimalatya.com.tr` has `ad_` but the current rule will not work on `yenimalatya.com.tr`
 It is explained here: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/143052#issuecomment-1432787752



### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

comment.body:
Not reproduced it on my end.
Try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).
Note, advanced protection should be turned on.

comment.body:
I have changed `/wp-content/plugins/google-analytics-for-wordpress/*` to `/wp-content/plugins/google-analytics-for-wordpress/assets/js/frontend*.js`, if I'm not wrong, it should blocks trackers and should not break this dashboard.
Filters update should be available in 1-2 hours.

comment.body:
I cannot reproduce banner.
<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29142494/219591208-9e8b8b14-dfdd-4645-a59d-d6a7bc3ab83e.png)

</details>

>and in-video first click leftovers

It seems that it's how it works in this case (video will be not loaded if `.play-btn[onclick="playPlayerInt()"]` will be not clicked).
It would be necessary to add JavaScript rule and I'm not sure if it's really needed in this case.

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.dell.com/support/order-status/de-de/order-detail?v=](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dell.com%2Fsupport%2Forder-status%2Fde-de%2Forder-detail%3Fv%3D) ### Comment Username: @Morku > It's impossible to track your item with AdGuard for Windows. The side Pop-up does not appear (instead: endless loading circle). > Due several personal information on the page, I can't provide the whole URL. > The issue is only with AdGuard for Windows, not the Extension. Disabling Ad blocking, privacy, internet security and extension does not fix the issue. I have to disable AdGuard for Windows entirely to make it work. > Remembered from a similar issue with `ebay.com` I have tested provided filters and only the combination of `@@||dell.com^$jsinject,elemhide,extension` does fix the issue. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
>(1) is always displayed when you are not logged in

This element is intentionally not blocked, because that's the most obvious way to log in.
We blocked it in the past, but there were reports about incorrect blocking - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/134187#issuecomment-1314168945

>(2) is displayed after a short time when you visit Twitter for the first time and click the tab at the top.

Could you please check this rule:
```adblock
twitter.com##div[role="group"][class="css-1dbjc4n r-1awozwy r-1kihuf0 r-18u37iz r-1pi2tsx r-1777fci r-1pjcn9w r-xr3zp9 r-1xcajam r-ipm5af r-g6jmlv"]
```

issue.title: Fix #142813 youtube.com
issue.body: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/142813#issuecomment-1430015026

comment.body:
After logging into your account, the Trending section disappears, and Shorts can be hidden (which I did).

In general, Shorts is not a main product of YouTube, and there is a separate page for them, the link to which is located directly under the Home in the left menu. And also for the Trending there is a separate page a little lower in this menu.

For me, Shorts are just an annoyance, since they are not the main product of YouTube, and the section with them takes up a significant part of the page. Therefore, I suggest adding this rule to self-promo.

issue.title: www.kontrolfreek.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.kontrolfreek.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.kontrolfreek.com) ### Comment Username: `@nshenkman` > Hello I am Engineer at Klaviyo. I believe your targeting for our JS may be too broad as it is preventing functionality on the website as demonstrated in the screenshots. We have worked hard to separate out our tracking JS from our non-tracking JS and load it via a separate subdomain. The correct targeting for tracking would be targeting static-tracking.klaviyo.com and telemetrics.klaviyo.com. Your existing targeting is preventing any of our JS from loading (tracking and non-tracking) as that file is entry to all JS being loaded. Here are some examples of other filters (easyprivacy) using these rules: > https://github.com/easylist/easylist/blob/master/easyprivacy/easyprivacy_thirdparty.txt#L1714 > https://github.com/easylist/easylist/blob/master/easyprivacy/easyprivacy_thirdparty.txt#L1871 > > To help out I have linked where I think the filter is located: > https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/SpywareFilter/sections/specific.txt#L1696 > > If you would like to investigate yourself the url I tested on is https://kontrolfreek.com but this issue persists on any website that uses Klaviyo. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/3YJkc2N.png)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/ySQahvp.jpg)

comment.body:
Although not reproducible on my end (last one), this should do the trick for the rare timing cases:
```adblock
tf1.fr,tf1info.fr#%#//scriptlet('prevent-fetch', 'static.adsafeprotected.com')
! Also possibly adding prevent-fetch too for the rare fallback alternative (HEAD request to / of ads.stickyadstv.com).
```
_(See [this post](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/133895#issuecomment-1301915301) > `Suggestion idea` part.)_

I'm going to look at that tonight or tomorrow.

Please add this rule:
```adblock
||duden.de/aab
```
to user rules.

issue.title: www.kontrolfreek.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.kontrolfreek.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.kontrolfreek.com) ### Comment Username: `@nshenkman` > Hello I am Engineer at Klaviyo. I believe your targeting for our JS may be too broad as it is preventing functionality on the website as demonstrated in the screenshots. We have worked hard to separate out our tracking JS from our non-tracking JS and load it via a separate subdomain. The correct targeting for tracking would be targeting static-tracking.klaviyo.com and telemetrics.klaviyo.com. Your existing targeting is preventing any of our JS from loading (tracking and non-tracking) as that file is entry to all JS being loaded. Here are some examples of other filters (easyprivacy) using these rules: > https://github.com/easylist/easylist/blob/master/easyprivacy/easyprivacy_thirdparty.txt#L1714 > https://github.com/easylist/easylist/blob/master/easyprivacy/easyprivacy_thirdparty.txt#L1871 > > To help out I have linked where I think the filter is located: > https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/SpywareFilter/sections/specific.txt#L1696 > > If you would like to investigate yourself the url I tested on is https://kontrolfreek.com but this issue persists on any website that uses Klaviyo. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/3YJkc2N.png)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/ySQahvp.jpg)

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: misskey.io
issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [X] Browser version is up-to-date; - [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard Browser Extension ### AdGuard version ver 4.1.53 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Missed ads or ad leftovers ### Which browser(s) do you use? Firefox ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? https://misskey.io/@kureharu_stk https://misskey.io/tags/%E6%B0%97%E3%81%8C%E7%8B%82%E3%81%A3%E3%81%9F%E3%81%A8%E3%81%8D%E3%81%AB%E6%8A%BC%E3%81%99%E3%83%9C%E3%82%BF%E3%83%B3 https://misskey.io/@itiradi/pages/1557466961730 ### What filters do you have enabled? AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Japanese filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots I tried with #142719 but I could not completely hide ad.
